description: While the archives are typically used for distributing software and updates to handheld devices, select routers , IoT devices, set-top boxes (e.g., media players and Smart TVs), and development boards (e.g., Raspberry Pi and BeagleBone) may also use them. Non-Linux systems rarely use IPK archives.
NOTE: The "Itsy Package" name originates from the Itsy Package Management System, designed for lightweight and embedded Linux systems.
